doc.after: The New York Police Department (NYPD) has been the largest police force in the United States by a significant margin, with over 35,000 sworn officers.[340] In 2012, New York City had the lowest overall crime rate and the second lowest murder rate among the largest U.S. cities,[341] having become significantly safer after a spike in crime in the 1980s[342] and early 1990s. By 2002, New York City's crime rate was similar to that of Provo, Utah and was ranked 197th in crime among the 216 U.S. cities with populations greater than 100,000.[343] Members of the NYPD are frequently referred to by politicians, the media, and their own police cars by the nickname, New York's Finest.
